main event: A gold globe, the size of a basketball, was observed moving northwest to southeast for about 15 seconds before gradually disappearing.
interesting points: The object had a steady flight path,The sighting occurred at night,The observer was MSGT Craig S. Hopkins from the 366th Army Band,The disappearance of the object could indicate a gradual fade rather than an abrupt end,No photographs were captured during the sighting.
witness description: MSGT Craig S. Hopkins, 366th Army Band, previously a pilot
